tpk::BaseVt

tpk::BaseVt Class Reference

#include <BaseVt.h>

Inheritance diagram for tpk::BaseVt:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Virtual base class for virtual telescope classes.

The BaseVt class is a virtual base class for virtual telescope like classes such as MountVt, AutoGuider etc. It provides some common methods and associated data members for setting a new target or pointing origin.

It also defines the interface to the update method so that the medium processing loop does not need to know the types of the virtual telescopes.

All the methods of this class are thread safe.

const Site &  site,
const RefSys &  trackFrame 
) [protected]

The newly created BaseVt object has the target set to 0.0, 0.0 in the tracking frame and the pointing origin to the rotator axis.

void tpk::BaseVt::setOffset ( const double &  alpha,
const double &  beta,
const RefSys &  offsetFrame 
) throw () [virtual]

Set target offset and reference frame.

The position that the virtual telescope is tracking can be offset from the target position by an amount in any reference frame. The offset in the tracking frame is re-calculate every time the pointing calculation runs.

The offset is in the tangent plane and the tangent point is the base position of the current target.

Parameters:
alpha  offset in alpha (radians)
beta  offset in beta (radians)
offsetFrame  reference system of offset

void tpk::BaseVt::setOffset ( const double &  alpha,
const double &  beta 
) throw () [virtual]

Set target offset.

The offset is set to the new values without changing the reference frame. If the frame has never been set it will default to be the same as the tracking frame.

Parameters:
alpha  offset in alpha (radians)
beta  offset in beta (radians)

void tpk::BaseVt::incrOffset ( const double &  alpha,
const double &  beta 
) throw () [virtual]

Increment target offset.

The specified offset is added to the existing offset. The reference frame is not changed.

Parameters:
alpha  offset in alpha (radians)
beta  offset in beta (radians)

void tpk::BaseVt::update ( const MountVt &  mount  )  throw (std::runtime_error) [protected, virtual]

Update target and reference frames.

The target is updated and copies of the tracking and offset reference frames updated. If a new target has not been set while this method was executing the updates reference frames are copied back into the virtual telescope context.

Exceptions:
std::runtime_error 
Parameters:
mount  mount virtual telescope

vector tpk::BaseVt::targetpos ( double  t,
double  sst,
double  cst 
) const throw () [protected, virtual]

Target position at a specified time.

The target position includes any offset.

Returns:
the position of the current target in the tracking frame
Parameters:
t  TAI (MJD)
sst  sine of sidereal time
cst  cosine of sidereal time

Member Data Documentation

const unsigned int tpk::BaseVt::maxsamp = 3 [static, protected]

Maximum number of samples.

This is the maximum number of samples that can be generated by the virtual telescope track methods. It should not be larger than the number of samples that can be handled by the Trajectory class.

bool tpk::BaseVt::mNewTarget [protected]

new target flag

This flag that signals to the SPM maintenance thread that a new target was set while it was executing and that therefore the SPMs it has generated should not be copied into the member variables.

double tpk::BaseVt::mWavel [protected]

effective wavelength (microns)

double tpk::BaseVt::mTai [protected]

TAI of last pointing calculation (MJD)

double tpk::BaseVt::mCst [protected]

cosine of sidereal time
